contentrichtext.text: '''Las Choapas''' is a city and its surrounding [[Municipalities of Veracruz|municipality]] in the southeastern extremes of the [[States of Mexico|state]] of [[Veracruz (state)|Veracruz]] in [[Mexico]]. It is bordered by the municipalities of [[Uxpanapa]], [[Minatitlán, Veracruz|Minatitlán]], [[Moloacán]], and [[Agua Dulce, Veracruz|Agua Dulce]] in Veracruz, [[Huimanguillo]] in [[Tabasco]], [[Cintalapa]] and [[Tecpatán]] in [[Chiapas]], and [[Santa María Chimalapa]] in [[Oaxaca]]. Las Choapas took the name after a small fish called "Chopa" which was a unique species in the Tancochapa River, which is the boundary between Veracruz and Tabasco. Its major products are cattle breeding, corn, oil, fruit, sugar, and rubber. In the past it had a rice miller. It is one of the largest municipalities in Veracruz, with an area of 2,851.2 km² (1,100.85 sq mi). At the 2005 census the city had a population of 40,773 inhabitants, while the municipality had a population of 70,092. It is a very hot place, as temperature reaches up to 40 degrees Celsius. It has had some [[tornado]]es in the past.
